availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George A. Bowyer (Lexington, Fayette County, KY, merchant tailor)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, tailor and merchant tailor. Virginia native. Married to Mary Bowyer. Father of George Bowyer, Clarance Bowyer, Charles Bowyer, Lution Bowyer, and Earnest Bowyer. Owned two enslaved persons in Tailor in Fayette County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Lexington in 1850. Merchant tailor in Lexington in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 94.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 206B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 2, p. 614.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, pp. 523-524.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington Ward 1, p. 460B.
Williams & Co., Compilers, Williams' Lexington City Directory for 1864-5, (Lexington, KY, 1864), 112.
